p.s: Nowadays, it is critizized if Shakespeare is still relevant in our lofe and society and especially for young people.
Today, you can find many marks of Shakespeare in literature.
But is Shakespearean literature actually that good for young peaplepeople and do they really need this in their education?
In my opinion I think teaching Shakespearean literature should not be that relevant today because it is totoo hard to understand for young students.
Firstly an important point is the language in Shakespearean literature.
For young people it is so hard to understand.
So for example, the tormented students have to translate on the one hand and read between the lines on the other hand.
At best way, they understand the words but not the meaning.
Secondly, it is really archaic and old-fashioned.
SO it is not that interesting for a young audience.
Therefore it can get boring quickly.
Nevertheles, is it true that Shakespeare is a part of English culture, and a history and language.
Furthermore, it is an inspiration for young writers and performing poetry helps to increase confidentsconfidence.
Some people are saying that his plays help you to gain an insight into human feelings.
But the fact, that Shakespeare didn't write books, but he wrote plays makes it more hard to read them and to understand them at the same time.

All the aspects that I mentioned for Shakespearean literature are not convincing enough for me and I am the opinion that the Shakespearean literature is not that relevant today or shouold not be that relevant in school.
